title: 8-8-16 Cheryl Brickey, Nancy McNally, Tammy Silvers, and Kate Henderson join Pat Sloan on American Patchwork and Quilting Radio
description:
I first got to know Cheryl Brickey of Meadow Mist designs when I saw some articles she did comparing products. She did such a great job I started to follow her site. When she did research and testing about ‘using sheets as backing’ I was sold on the idea! We’ll talk about writing about quilting, designs and she’ll give us her sheet analysis
http://meadowmistdesigns.blogspot.com/
=================
I look at a lot of quilting things, groups online, books sent by publishers, Quilt magazines and websites. I ran across Nancy McNally’s from One Stitch at a time and decided I need to learn more! She is fun, does amazing quilts and always has great tips!
www.nancymcnallyquilts.com
================
Tammy Silvers is the designer behind Tamarinis and love color and fun quilts! She contributes to American Patchwork & Quilting family of magazines with her project Happy Haunting in the Fall 2016 issue. She travels to teach and is creates quilt patterns that fun and easy to make!
www.tamarinis.com
==================
Kate Henderson love quilts strips and she is not afraid to use them in wonderful and effective ways! With two books on strip quilts I'm really excited to talk to her all the way from Australia. And I asked Kate what the oldest quilt tool she owns, I wonder if you have one too? 
http://neverenoughhours.blogspot.com/ 
================
visit American Patchwork & Quilting at http://allpeoplequilt.com
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/apqmagazine
Visit host Pat Sloan at http://www.patsloan.com
